oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Indian graves unearthed, Goodlettsville, Tennessee, 1958 August 28
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The discovery of two Indian graves unearthed in Goodlettsville, described in the Aug. 28th, 1958 Nashville Banner: “Beside a Goodlettsville chimney, two Indian graves were unearthed Thursday by excavators on the old William Connell Farm, a mile north of Goodlettsville on old Springfield Road. Outlined with stones, the graves were discovered during remodeling of the 118-year-old Connell house. The landmark will become the home of Mr. and Mrs. J.C. Garrett who recently purchased the house and a number of surrounding acres.” Forms part of Nashville Banner Negatives Collection. 1 photographic negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
